glsa.title: aria2: Multiple vulnerabilities
glsa.synopsis: A buffer overflow and a format string vulnerability in aria2 allow remote attackers to execute arbitrary code.

background.p: aria2 is a download utility with resuming and segmented downloading with HTTP/HTTPS/FTP/BitTorrent support.

description.p: Tatsuhiro Tsujikawa reported a buffer overflow in DHTRoutingTableDeserializer.cc (CVE-2009-3575) and a format string vulnerability in the AbstractCommand::onAbort() function in src/AbstractCommand.cc (CVE-2009-3617).

impact.p: A remote, unauthenticated attacker could possibly execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the user running the application or cause a Denial of Service (application crash).

workaround.p: Do not use DHT (CVE-2009-3575) and disable logging (CVE-2009-3617).

resolution.p: All aria2 users should upgrade to the latest version:
